intro: Scleranthus cettinjensis, commonly known as the Cettinje thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan region. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and spiny leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in mountainous areas. It has small, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs, and its flowers are arranged in dense clusters. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
